intro: Waltheria macropoda, commonly known as the broadleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and herbs. The plant is characterized by its large, showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in the morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Waltheria macropoda is typically found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges.
